TopicTitle: Can you make Better soundtrack for KSP

Articles.Content:
First i'm glad that the forum is back online.

Returning to the topic do you remember space-sim called "Orbiter" it has great soundtrack Bach "Air on G" it would nice if we had something classic in soundtrack.

And speaking about "Orbiter" what do you think about it, i think it was awesome, but when i recently installed it i have some compatibility problem on My Windows 8. I liked especially Vostok/Voskhod, Mercury and Apollo add-on. But i never made successful TLI not to mention interplanetary flights.

But today i made successful flight to Jool, without MechJeb, i mean almost i used Planetary Phase angle calculator to get good interplanetary burn. I was forced to use Ion engine to enter Jool Orbit. unfortunately i lowered perapis to low and my probe crashed on Jool. Fortunately i saved the saves when i was on High orbit around Jool:-)

PS What is the best altitude to areobrake Jool???
I love the music in it currently, I get lost in this game with it
I think this is a good idea, some original tracks would be nice. Stock music that is used in a Dwarf Fortress sound engine kinda throws me off.

The problem with the in-game music are the copyright issues, but (I think) this can be solved by letting us put our "Legally downloaded" soundtracks on the game. Just like we used to do on San Andreas, you could have your own radio station by inserting new mp3 files on the game folder; It would be the same as installing mods.

I think the current music is awesome, the space-centre music is perfect for the calm yet busy sounds it makes whilst i try to figure out my designs, and in space it even sounds like Vangelis in places, i just wish there was more of it, but it's arrangement is really good so far, i love how it kicks in once i'm in space, really gives the feeling of "yeah i've arrived!"

I think the stock music is good too, especially the whale noises type one.

Though, it could use more variety. I'm thinking the type of music that was in Homeworld.

The problem with the in-game music are the copyright issues, but (I think) this can be solved by letting us put our "Legally downloaded" soundtracks on the game. Just like we used to do on San Andreas, you could have your own radio station by inserting new mp3 files on the game folder; It would be the same as installing mods.

Bach Music isn't copyright protected, i remember when i play Orbiter i very liked it.

Bach Music isn't copyright protected, i remember when i play Orbiter i very liked it.

You could also try turning the music all the way down, and playing some Bach from another source in the background; i.e. Itunes or Pandora.
